exploder:
XSplit requires the column to be exploded. Split does not require the column to be exploded. XSplit usually is required when explodeColumns attribute is defined and a column alias that calls a item in a multivalue array is also defined. For a view that does not have explodeColumns, the effect of XSplit and Split is the same. Split is usually used for non-exploded views but one or more columns defined requires a scalar value from a multivalue array.
Escape charaters for custom code definition following the subsitute mark "?": One empty space: \s Period: \x2E
Valid -> ColumnName?#^ColumnName.IfTrue(Equals(''),\sNULL) Not valid -> ColumnName?#^ColumnName.IfTrue(Equals(''), NULL)
Valid -> ColumnName?#^ColumnName.Split('\x2E')[3] Not valid -> ColumnName?#^ColumnName.Split('.')[3]
Explicit SQL may use the "." as is: Valid -> ColumnName?*ColumnName.REPLACE('*','.')
For primaryKey attribute, use actual or alias column name. For explodeColumns attribute, use actual column name, NOT alias.
HIST_NUM always return NULL for FBNK_FUNDS_TRANSFER_EXTEND will not be included
It seems the STG is almost the original download because it has "@ID" as one of the columns. Also, the 2 tables w/o the "STG" suffix has a "GB_ID" column which is custom and the counts are less. <file name="FBNK_RE_CRF_UNGPGL"> <view name="FBNK_RE_CRF_UNGPGL_STG" schema="l" explodeColumns="" selectionClause="" columns="@ID CURRENCY DESC_1 DESC_2 LOCAL_BALANCE FOREIGN_BALANCE MATURITY_DATE SCHED_LOCAL_BAL SCHED_FCY_BAL CONSOL_KEY CUSTOMER_NO DEAL_BALANCE DEAL_LCY_BALANCE DEAL_RATE DEAL_VALUE_DATE DEAL_MAT_DATE DEAL_MAT_PERIOD DEAL_REMAINING_DAYS LINE_TOTAL" /> </file> <file name="FBNK_RE_CRF_UNGPPL"> <view name="FBNK_RE_CRF_UNGPPL_STG" schema="l" explodeColumns="" selectionClause="" columns="@ID CURRENCY DESC_1 DESC_2 LOCAL_BALANCE FOREIGN_BALANCE MATURITY_DATE SCHED_LOCAL_BAL SCHED_FCY_BAL CONSOL_KEY CUSTOMER_NO DEAL_BALANCE DEAL_LCY_BALANCE DEAL_RATE DEAL_VALUE_DATE DEAL_MAT_DATE DEAL_MAT_PERIOD DEAL_REMAINING_DAYS LINE_TOTAL" /> </file>
ColumnName?ColumnName[Max] grabs last item of an array.
THE above could have used alias as seen below. Note that "?a.ColumnName[d]" and "?#$a.ColumnName[d]" results are the same.
Immed process code syntax, immediately after download, before multivalue explode: #- Pre process code syntax, after multi-value explode, before final sub-value explode: ?#^ Post process code syntax, after sub-value explode: ?#$ If alias is used, use alias for the Split function. Supports Sql Alias: ?*a.ColumnName Support Sql Functions: ?*MAX(a.ColumnName)
******* 2008 TAX TABLES ****************************************
Replace function usage. Accepted arguments patterns are (where #=number, ?=1 character, $=any string): Replace((char)#,(char)#), Replace((char)#,'?'), Replace('?',(char)#), Replace('$','$')")
ForceRepeat(0) is a very specialized function that was designed to match a particular instance where the first multivalue is forced to appear for every exploded item. This attribute would probably not be used elsewhere. Typical used in preprocessor code, i.e. "#^". The parameter indicates ordinal position of the multivalue. All other multivalue will be ignored except for the parameter defined value and it will be used for every exploded record, regardless of whether this multivalue was originally defined for this exploded record or not.
Exploding BUSS_ERR_MSG, SYS_ERR_MSG for FBNK_UCSID_ERROR_LOG creates 829873 from 2058. Require selection criteria to reduce record count.
Usage: ColumnName.IfTrue(Contains(),substitute value) Usage2: ColumnName.IfTrue(@AnotherColumnName.Contains(),substitute value) Boolean expression supports "Contains", "Equals", "StartsWith" method. Substitute value is explicit. Substitute value defined as "NULL" returns empty string (i.e.,""). Use "\s" for empty space
To exclude a value after explosion, use the "!" symbol followed by an array list, separated by a comma. For example, !{NULL,1,abc}.
ColumnName?ColumnName[d] works when there is no explodeColumns defined. If there is, use ColumnName?ColumnName.XSplit(']')[0]
########################################################################################## The following table definitions are for those tables that were uploaded AS IS without exploding and which counts were matched. ##########################################################################################
AUTO_ID is supported as #$ROWID() (Post Explode Function)
